(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.

Station in Crime No. 244/2023.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)

Charge : Offences punishable under sections 323, 324, 448, 341, 506(i)
and 354 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused numbers 1 to 3 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 323, 324, 448, 341, 506(i) and 354
read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are
acquitted of the said offences under section 248(1) Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and
they are set at liberty.

This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 323, 324, 448,
341, 506(i) and 354 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the prior enmity On
18.3.2023, at 7 am the accused no.1 trespassed into the premises of the house
of CW1 and break opened the door of her bathroom and kicked on her right
thigh and thereafter destructed the flush tank .It is alleged that that when CW 1
ran away from there to her house the accused no .1 to 3 were followed her ,and
the accused no.3 caught hold her ,thereafter the accused no.1 fisted on her
back and the accused no.2 slapped on her face . Thus accused Nos. 1 to 3 have
committed offenses u/ss. 323, 324, 448, 341, 506(i) and 354 read with section
34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police Thumba
police station and the case was taken on file as CC. 51/2024. Cognizance was
taken for the offences punishable w/ss. 323, 324, 448, 341, 506(i) and 354 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the accused persons.

3 of 6

3. On appearance of the accused Nos. 1 to 3 they were enlarged on bail on
06.04.2023. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to them
under section 207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution
and counsel for accused Nos. 1 to 3 charge framed for offences w/ss. 323, 324,
448, 341, 506(i) and 354 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860, read
over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 to 3 to which they pleaded not guilty
and claimed to be tried.

4. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit P1 was marked. As
the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW10.. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused Nos.1 to 3 , questioning of the
accused Nos. 1 to 3, under section 313(1)(b) of Cr.P.C. was dispensed with.
Accused Nos. 1 to 3 were called upon to adduce evidence but no defence
evidence was adduced from the side of the accused Nos 1 to 3.

5. Heard both sides and perused records.

6. The following points have arisen for determination:

1. Whether accused Nos. 1 to 3 in furtherance of their common intention,
accused No.1 kicked on PW1’s right thigh and fisted on her back, accused
no.3 caught hold her and the accused no.2 slapped on her face and thereby
committed an offence punishable w/s. 323 read with section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 ?

2. Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention, accused No.1 kicked on PW1’s right
thigh and fisted on her back, accused no.3 caught hold her and the accused

4 of 6
no.2 slapped on her face and thereby committed an offence punishable uw/s.
324 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

3. Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention trespassed into the premises of the
house of PW1 and break opened the door of her bathroom and thereby
committed an offence punishable w/s. 448 read with section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 ?

4. Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 infurtherance of
their common intention, wrongfully restrained PW1 and thereby committed
offence punishable under section 341 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

5. Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention threatened PW1 and thereby
committed an offence punishable u/s. 506(i) r/w. section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 ?

6. Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 3 in
furtherance of their common intention to outrage the modesty of PW1,
accused No.1 break opened the door of her bathroom and kicked on her
right thigh and accused no.3 caught hold her thereby committed an offence
punishable under section 354 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

7. If the accused Nos. 1 to 3 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

7. Point Nos.. 1 to 6:-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 6 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that the accused have committed
offences punishable under sections 323, 324, 448, 341, 506(i) and 354 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

8. PW1 admitted her signature in the Ext P 1 statement .She deposed that she has
no grievance against the accused persons, and the accused persons have
neither assaulted nor cause destruction of her property -According to her she

5 of 6
had not sustained any injury by the alleged incident and she is not intending to
proceed with the case .

9. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and she
is justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused Nos. 1 to 3 and for the
said reason these points are found against the prosecution.

3. Point No.7 :- Upon the finding in point nos. 1 to 6, the accused Nos. 1 to 3 are
found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 323, 324, 448, 341,
506(i) and 354 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are
acquitted for the said offences under section 248(1) of Criminal Procedure
Code 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.

No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 20" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
